What is the structure of Modus Tollens?
The structure of Modus Tollens is as follows: If A implies B and not C, then not B implies not A. Therefore, not A.

~T        Modus tollens 1, 5  14. 1. (A v B⊃ ~C 2. C v D 3. A  /∴ D 4. A v B       Addition 3 Answers to exercises  225 5. ~C         Modus ponens 1, 4 6. D          Disjunctive syllogism 2, 5  15. 1. L v (M ⊃ N) 2. ~L ⊃ (N ⊃ O) 3. ~L  /∴ M ⊃ O 4. N ⊃ O      Modus ponens 2, 3 5. M ⊃ N      Disjunctive syllogism 1, 3 6. M ⊃ O      Hypothetical syllogism 4, 5  16. 1. A ⊃ B 2. A v (C ⋅ D) 3. ~B ⋅ ~E /∴ C 4. ~B      Simplification 3 5. ~A      Modus tollens 1, 4 6. C ⋅ D    Disjunctive syllogism 2, 5 7.
